extendedIngredients.name: fire-roasted tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup canned fire-roasted diced tomatoes, drained

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red bell peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 2 (7 1/2-ounce) jars roasted red bell peppers, drained

title: Grilled Shrimp with Romesco Sauce
summary: The recipe Grilled Shrimp with Romesco Sauce is ready in around 45 minutes and is definitely an outstanding dairy free and pescatarian option for lovers of European food. This recipe makes 12 servings with 168 calories, 24g of protein, and 5g of fat each. For $2.72 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. It is brought to you by My Recipes. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up salt, wine vinegar, slivered almonds, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. Not a lot of people really liked this main course. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 42%, which is pretty good. Try Grilled Shrimp with Romesco Sauce, Grilled Garlic Shrimp with Romesco Sauce, and Grilled Shrimp with Cocoa-Nib Romesco Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.                                                                                                 Place first 10 ingredients in a food processor, and process until smooth.                                                                                                 Place shrimp on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill shrimp 3 minutes on each side or until done. Garnish with parsley, if desired, and serve with sauce.

steps.step: Place first 10 ingredients in a food processor, and process until smooth.
Place shrimp on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill shrimp 3 minutes on each side or until done.
Garnish with parsley, if desired, and serve with sauce.
